23.text:
So you've got trials riders and then I hang
around with some people that do parkour

27.text:
and whenever you're with those people, BMX
as well,

31.text:
they just look at the city in such a different
way.

43.text:
The Heygate Estate is my favourite place in
London.

47.text:
I guess the way I see this is very different
to the way someone else might see it,

52.text:
so that they might feel fear or they may just
be apathetic,

56.text:
but for me there's a connection. It's like
a, I guess like a child in a playground.

70.text:
You're looking at what you're about to do
and you know you can do it

74.text:
but your mind's telling you, this is kind
of a weird thing to do.

98.text:
I could be on a bus or I could be going past
a spot

102.text:
or on the train and I just, I see this spot
and I just, it all goes slow motion

106.text:
and I see myself jumping in the air with some
really

110.text:
kind of slow violin type music,
it's all slow-motion, it's just beautiful,

160.text: You know, it's this kind of architecture that

163.text:
you really think
wow, this is what I can connect with in London.
